comments.body: This is empty because the URL parse fails?  What is the current behavior when this value is included in kubeconfig file?

Yes, empty because the parse fails. I haven't tested with a kubeconfig file
-- can you point me to a kubeconfig test that I can play with?

On Thu, Jun 4, 2015 at 12:03 PM, David Eads notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In pkg/client/clientcmd/client_config_test.go
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/9171#discussion_r31735536
> :
> 
> > ```
> > matchStringArg(config.Clusters["clean"].APIVersion, clientConfig.Version, t)
> > matchBoolArg(config.Clusters["clean"].InsecureSkipTLSVerify, clientConfig.Insecure, t)
> > matchStringArg(config.AuthInfos["clean"].Token, clientConfig.BearerToken, t)
> > ```
> > 
> >  }
> > 
> > +func TestCreateCleanWithPrefix(t *testing.T) {
> > -   tt := []struct {
> > -       server string
> > -       host   string
> > -       prefix string
> > -   }{
> > -       {"https://anything.com:8080/foo/bar", "https://anything.com:8080", "/foo/bar"},
> > -       {"http://anything.com:8080/foo/bar", "http://anything.com:8080", "/foo/bar"},
> > -       {"http://anything.com:8080/foo/bar/", "http://anything.com:8080", "/foo/bar/"},
> > -       {"http://anything.com:8080/", "http://anything.com:8080/", ""},
> > -       {"http://anything.com:8080//", "http://anything.com:8080", "//"},
> > -       {"anything.com:8080/foo/bar", "anything.com:8080/foo/bar", ""},
> 
> This is empty because the URL parse fails? What is the current behavior
> when this value is included in kubeconfig file?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/9171/files#r31735536
> .

Added a test case to that, let me know if you were looking for something
different.
